subclassFeature.name: Song Domain
entries: At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency in {@skill Performance} if already proficient your proficiency bonus is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Song of Strength
entries: Starting at 1st level, you use your control over sound and song to create safety for your allies. As an action you can start singing, this does not inhibit you from casting spells with vocal components. For 1 minute when a creature within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage or advantage on that roll.
At 10th level the advantage or disadvantage is for their entire attack action.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus rounded up per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Song of Protection
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to sing a song of protection. As an action choose a number of creatures equal to half your proficiency bonus rounded down (Minimum of 1). These creatures gain an increase of 1 AC and add their proficiency when making concentration checks. While singing this song you must use your bonus action on subsequent turns to maintain the song, otherwise the song ends at the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Trained Ears
entries: Starting at 6th level, your mastery over sound grants you special abilities:

items: You have resistance to thunder damage.
When saving against an effect or a spell that is based on sound (DM discretion) or deals thunder damage, you gain advantage on the save.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip and you can replace their damage type with thunder damage.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} damage of the same type dealt by the weapon to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of Song
entries: At 17th level, you master sound and song:

items: You gain immunity to thunder damage.
Your channel divinity: Song of Protection does not need bonus actions on subsequent turns.
While singing the Song of Protection you gain 1 AC and benefit from half cover.
